Package dev.sergiferry.playernpc.api

Class NPCLib

java.lang.Object
dev.sergiferry.playernpc.api.NPCLib
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.bukkit.event.Listener
public class NPCLib extends Object implements org.bukkit.event.Listener
NPCLib is a simple library to create NPCs and customize them. Spigot resource https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/playernpc.93625/
Since:
2021.1

  • Constructor Details

    • NPCLib

      public NPCLib​(dev.sergiferry.playernpc.PlayerNPCPlugin plugin)
      The NPCLib instance must be called thought getInstance()

      You must not call this constructor.

      Parameters:
      plugin - is the PlayerNPCPlugin instance
      See Also:
      getInstance()

  • Method Details

    • generateNPC

      public NPC generateNPC​(@Nonnull org.bukkit.entity.Player player, @Nonnull String code, @Nonnull org.bukkit.Location location)
      Generates the NPC instance.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player who will see the NPC
      code - the id of the NPC to access it later
      location - the location that the NPC will spawn

    • getNPC

      public NPC getNPC​(@Nonnull org.bukkit.entity.Player player, @Nonnull String id)
      Get the NPC instance of a Player with specific ID.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player who sees the NPC
      id - the id of the NPC
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.

    • getNPCs

      public Set<NPC> getNPCs​(@Nonnull org.bukkit.entity.Player player, @Nonnull String prefix)
      Get a Set of NPC instances of a Player with the prefix on the ID.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player who sees the NPCs
      prefix - the prefix that have all the NPCs
      Returns:
      A Set of NPC instances.

    • getNPCs

      public Set<NPC> getNPCs​(@Nonnull org.bukkit.entity.Player player, @Nonnull org.bukkit.World world)
      Get a Set of NPC instances of a Player that are at on specific World.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player who sees the NPC
      world - the world where are the NPCs
      Returns:
      A Set of NPC instances.

    • hasNPC

      public boolean hasNPC​(@Nonnull org.bukkit.entity.Player player, @Nonnull String id)
      Detects if the Player has an NPC with the specific ID.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player who sees the NPC
      id - the id of the NPC
      Returns:
      A Boolean if the Player has an NPC with the specific ID.

    • removeNPC

      public NPC removeNPC​(@Nonnull org.bukkit.entity.Player player, @Nonnull String id)
      Removes the NPC instance of a Player with specific ID.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player who sees the NPC
      id - the id of the NPC
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.

    • removeNPC

      public NPC removeNPC​(@Nonnull org.bukkit.entity.Player player, @Nonnull NPC npc)
      Removes the NPC instance of a Player.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player who sees the NPC
      npc - the NPC instance
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.

    • getGlobalNPC

      public Set<NPC> getGlobalNPC​(@Nonnull String code)
      Get a Set of NPC instances with the specific ID. This will return all the NPCs even they are not from the same Player.
      Parameters:
      code - the ID of the NPCs
      Returns:
      A Set of NPC instances.

    • setUpdateLookType

      public void setUpdateLookType​(@Nonnull NPCLib.UpdateLookType updateLookType)
      In order to do some recurrent actions on the NPC you can choose between doing it every certain ticks or doing it when player is moving listening PlayerMoveEvent
      Parameters:
      updateLookType - the type of update
      See Also:
      setUpdateLookTicks(Integer), getUpdateLookType()

    • setUpdateLookTicks

      public void setUpdateLookTicks​(Integer ticks)
      Sets the interval of ticks between every check of movement. By default, is 5 ticks.

      Less ticks will produce more lag

      Parameters:
      ticks - the amount of ticks
      See Also:
      setUpdateLookType(UpdateLookType)

    • getAllNPCs

      public Set<NPC> getAllNPCs​(@Nonnull org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Get a Set of NPC instances of a Player with all the NPCs.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player who sees the NPC
      Returns:
      A Set of NPC instances.

    • getDefaultHideDistance

      public Double getDefaultHideDistance()
      When the player is far enough, the NPC will temporally hide, in order to be more efficient. And when the player approach, the NPC will be unhidden. You can change each NPC Hide Distance, but by default, will be this value.
      Returns:
      Double the distance in blocks
      See Also:
      setDefaultHideDistance(Double), NPC.setHideDistance(double), NPC.getHideDistance()

    • setDefaultHideDistance

      public void setDefaultHideDistance​(Double hideDistance)
      When the player is far enough, the NPC will temporally hide, in order to be more efficient. And when the player approach, the NPC will be unhidden. You can change each NPC Hide Distance, but by default, will be this value.
      Parameters:
      hideDistance - the distance in blocks
      See Also:
      getDefaultHideDistance(), NPC.setHideDistance(double), NPC.getHideDistance()

    • getUpdateLookType

      public NPCLib.UpdateLookType getUpdateLookType()
      In order to do some recurrent actions on the NPC you can choose between doing it every certain ticks or doing it when player is moving listening PlayerMoveEvent
      Returns:
      NPCLib.UpdateLookType if using ticks or PlayerMoveEvent
      See Also:
      setUpdateLookType(UpdateLookType)

    • getInstance

      public static NPCLib getInstance()
